column2: SOUTH DAKOTA PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: SD

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column6: Lane ends

column2: 2. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 3. If the vehicle is equipped with air bags, seat belts:
column6: are optional.

column2: 4. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 5. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 6. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column6: drive a few MPH slower than most.
column8: drive a few MPH faster than most.

column2: 7. A yellow arrow means:
column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Do not pass

column2: 9. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column6: Yes, always.

column2: 10. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 11. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

column2: 12. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 13. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 14. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Stop and yield the right of way.
column6: Stop and wait for the green light

column2: 15. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 16. A broken yellow line on your side of the roadway only means:
column4: Passing is permitted on both sides.
column6: Passing is not permitted on either side.
column8: Passing is permitted on your side of the roadway.

column2: 17. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column6: cross the tracks.

column2: 18. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: apply the brakes firmly.

column2: 19. A driver distraction is anything that:
column4: takes the attention away from driving.
column6: causes excessive concentration while driving.

column2: 20. A flashing red light:
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 21. The golden rule of driving is to:
column4: put on your emergency flashers when driving at night.
column6: drive faster than the vehicle behind you.
column8: treat others the way you want to be treated.

column2: 22. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column6: all students are off the bus.
column8: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad Crossing

column2: 24. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column6: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 25. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.
column6: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
column8: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
